title.narrative: Strengthening capacity to cope with climate change and increase food security

description.narrative: - Organization of advocacy workshops on Climate Change with relevant actors in Haiti. - Organization by the PSC-CC a workshop with parliamentarians on international treaties and conventions on the protection of the environment. - Participation of the various PSC-CC COP and presentation of the results. - Organization by the PSC-CC broadcasting emissions and press briefings. - Elaboration by the PSC-CC newsletters, brochures and newspaper articles. - Participation of PSC-CC to invitations received

The ACT Forum in Haiti designed the joint program addressing climate change and disaster risk management. This joint project which was funded over the years by 8 members of ACT Alliance and LWR and its project partner Service Chretien d'Haiti (SCH), was appointed to manage it. The project aims to increase the awareness of civil society organizations and government bodies on climate change and disaster risk reduction as well as mobilizing communities to build resilience within these communities to increase food security.
Goal: Strengthening the actions of civil societies by requiring good public policy practices on climate change and resilience of vulnerable communities to food insecurity. Objectives: 1. The Civil Society Platform on Climate Change (PSC-CC) influences the implementation and extension of good public policy on Climate Change. 2. The population is sensitized and adopts responsible behavior that enhances the resilience of communities to climate change.
